title: Smart Room Comfort and Air Quality Advisor (IoT)
impactLine: Delivered a low-cost IoT system that transforms raw environmental sensor data into an intuitive real-time comfort assessment.
problem: Traditional indoor monitoring systems expose raw sensor readings that require manual interpretation, making it difficult for users to understand overall comfort and air quality conditions.
constraints: Limited processing power and memory on microcontroller
Need for non-blocking, reliable real-time operation
Continuous cloud connectivity without data loss

decisions.title: Composite Comfort Scoring Algorithm
decisions.why: Combining temperature, humidity, air quality, lighting, and occupancy into a single score provided actionable insight instead of raw values.

decisions.title: Non-Blocking Firmware Architecture
decisions.why: Timer-driven execution using millis() ensured stable sensor polling, display updates, and cloud communication without watchdog resets.

architecture.overview: A layered IoT architecture combining multi-sensor acquisition, embedded processing, local feedback, and cloud-based dashboards.
bullets: ESP8266 NodeMCU microcontroller with integrated Wi-Fi
BME280, BH1750, MQ135, and PIR sensors for environmental sensing
Local OLED display and LED indicators for instant feedback
Blynk IoT cloud platform for remote monitoring and data visualization

implementationNotes: Integrated multiple digital and analog sensors using I2C and GPIO interfaces.
Computed comfort levels using threshold-based scoring inspired by indoor comfort guidelines.
Implemented SSL-secured cloud communication with virtual pin mapping.
Displayed real-time data locally on OLED and remotely on mobile and web dashboards.
results: Reliable real-time monitoring with 1-second sensor updates
Clear GOOD / OK / BAD comfort classification for users
Stable cloud synchronization without communication loss
Delivered complete system at a hardware cost of approximately SGD 40
tradeoffs: Air quality sensing is qualitative rather than ppm-accurate
Comfort scoring thresholds require calibration for different environments
nextImprovements: Mobile notifications for prolonged poor air quality
